quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Aids and People
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, aids, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: How many continents are generally considered to be there on Earth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 7

questions.question: In 1981 people with AIDS were diagnosed with the term GRID. What did GRID mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gay-Related Immune Deficiency

questions.question: Which of these regions is most affected by AIDS, as about 60% of all the HIV-infected people in the world live there?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sub-Saharan Africa

questions.question: Who distributed the first red ribbon as an anti-AIDS symbol?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul Jabara

questions.question: This non-government anti-AIDS organization was founded by Bono and Bobby Shriver in 2002 with start up capital from Bill Gates.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Debt, AIDS, Trade in Africa

questions.question: The Central Common Chimpanzee, native to Cameroon, is known to be the origin of which of the viruses causing AIDS?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: HIV-1

questions.question: What does the abbreviation AIDS actually stand for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Acquired immune deficiency syndrome

questions.question: What day is internationally recognised and annually observed as World AIDS Day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: December 1

questions.question: How long does it take for the planet Earth to orbit the Sun once?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 365 Days

questions.question: Which line contains only names of people who have or had AIDS?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Magic Johnson, Isaac Asimov

questions.question: Which of the following statements about AIDS is true?

options.text: AIDS can be transmitted through casual contact with an HIV-positive person.
You cant get AIDS through oral sex.
HIV does not actually cause AIDS.
You cant get AIDS from a mosquito bite.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: You cant get AIDS from a mosquito bite.

questions.question: How long is one day on planet Earth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: About 24 hours

questions.question: What was the name of the Earths first artificial satellite?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sputnik 1

questions.question: When a heterosexual couple has sex using a latex condom, what can create risk of HIV-infection?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oil-based lubricants

questions.question: The Earths atmosphere comprises of which two main elements?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oxygen and Nitrogen

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Map and Pair
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, pair, s. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This famous mathematician’s main interest was set theory. He is famous for his diagonal method” of proof.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cantor

questions.question: If you multiply any six consecutive whole numbers the product will be divisible by 8.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What function is equal to its derivative?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: y = e ^ x

questions.question: Which planet in the Solar System is sometimes referred to as Earths sister planet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Venus

questions.question: A “combination lock“ has three integers. Each integer is a member of this set: {0, 1, 2, 3, 4,}. How many such locks with different combinations can be made?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 125

questions.question: On a plane, a map is drawn so that the border of any two intersecting areas is more than just one point. You wish to color the map so that two intersecting area have different colors.  What is the minimal number of colors you will need to color any such map?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4

questions.question: What percentage of the Earths surface is covered by water?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roughly 70%

questions.question: Which mathematician proved that every angle can be trisected?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No one ever could

questions.question: A pair of fair dice are rolled and the numbers on the dice are added. What is the probability that you will roll a seven?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 6 out of 36

questions.question: Although he is known primarily as a physicist, Albert Einstein did make at least one very important contribution to modern mathematics. In which field was this contribution?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tensor analysis

questions.question: Both Newton and Leibnitz claimed credit for inventing” calculus. Which statement about calculus is true?

options.text: Whoever invented it, we use Leibnitz notation.
Whoever invented it, we use Newton’s notation.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Whoever invented it, we use Leibnitz notation.

questions.question: Scientists estimate that the Earth and the Solar System were formed how long ago?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4.5 billion years

questions.question: In mathematics, 6!” is read as six factorial”. Calculate 6!
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 720

questions.question: What do mathematicians call a quadrilateral with exactly one pair of parallel sides?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A trapezoid

questions.question: The Earth orbits the Sun at an average distance of how many million miles?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 93

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Symbol and Niobium
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, following, gold. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the symbol for Niobium?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nb

questions.question: What is the symbol for Gold?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Au

questions.question: What is the symbol for Vanadium?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: V

questions.question: What is the symbol for Iron?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fe

questions.question: The seminal vesicle opens into which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: urethra

questions.question: What is the symbol for Magnesium?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mg

questions.question: What is the symbol for Thallium?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tl

questions.question: Urine and semen are expelled in the urethra.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is the symbol for Cobalt?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Co

questions.question: What maintains the male secondary sex characteristics?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: androgen

questions.question: What is the symbol for Polonium?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Po

questions.question: What is the male reproductive organ which secretes an alkaline fluid?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: prostate gland

questions.question: Find the mode of this list of numbers: 0,0,0,1,0,3,6,8,0.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 0

questions.question: Who was the first US President to publish a mathematical proof?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Garfield

questions.question: The testes contain very fine coiled tubes known as the seminal vesicles.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Land and Symbol
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, watermelon, products. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Acid rain is defined as rain with a pH of below this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 5.6

questions.question: Wood, water, air, wax, natural gas, paper, cardboard and leather are all renewable resources.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Scallops live a sedentary live and never move around.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Every day this number of species of plants and animals become extinct.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 50 - 100

questions.question: What term is used by skiers to describe wet granular snow?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Corn

questions.question: Grasslands cover this part of land on Earth.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1/5th

questions.question: Deserts are advancing and taking over the land. For instance, in Mali the desert is advancing at this speed.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 11 miles per year

questions.question: In the winter of 1998-1999 this U.S. state broke the record of Mt. Ranier from 1971-1972 for the largest amount of cumulative snowfall in history.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Washington

questions.question: In Africa, a certain type of chimpanzees have been observed making snowballs.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of these products takes more than 30 years to biodegrade?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nylon fabric

questions.question: What is the symbol for Helium?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He

questions.question: What is the symbol for Copper?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cu

questions.question: The Antarctic ozone hole reached one of its largest ever sizes in September 2000 when it was 11.5 million square miles (29,784,863 square km).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Choose the statement about watermelon snow that is not true.

options.text: Watermelon snow is pink in color.
Watermelon snow is created when the suns rays reflect off of it.
Watermelon snow is caused by red colored algae.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Watermelon snow is created when the suns rays reflect off of it.

questions.question: Many credit this book by Rachel Carson with launching the environmentalist movement.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Silent Spring

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Scale and Bee
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, hamilton-norwood, avalanche. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the known top speed that a snow avalanche can reach?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 60 mph (95 km/h)

questions.question: What scale is used by astronomers to rate the potential hazard of impact of a near-earth object?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Palermo Technical Impact Hazard Scale

questions.question: A tropical storm with sustained winds exceeding 33 meters per second, which occurs in the Northwest Pacific Ocean west of the dateline, is called this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Typhoon

questions.question: What is the name of the scale created by an entomologist who had been stung by almost every type of bee, ant, and wasp?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Schmidt Sting Pain Scale

questions.question: This scale was originally used to determine the level of consciousness after head trauma.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Glasgow Coma Scale

questions.question: Who proposed a general method of classifying how technologically advanced a civilization is?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kardashev

questions.question: The term hurricane indicates a tropical storm which occurs in the northern hemisphere, whereas this term refers to the southern hemisphere.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cyclone

questions.question: The absolute hardness of a diamond  measures 1500, on which scale?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mohs scale of mineral hardness

questions.question: What scale measures the sexual orientation from 0 (exclusively heterosexual) to 6 (exclusively homosexual?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kinsey Scale

questions.question: Which of these is classified on the Hamilton-Norwood scale?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: male hair loss

questions.question: Which of the following is a description of an earthquake with magnitude 4.9 according to the Richter Scale?

options.text: Can cause serious damage in areas several hundred miles across.
Often felt, but rarely causes damage.
Noticeable shaking of indoor items, rattling noises. Significant damage unlikely.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Noticeable shaking of indoor items, rattling noises. Significant damage unlikely.

questions.question: One of the factors necessary for the formation of a tropical cyclone is a warm sea surface to a certain depth.  As a minimum, how warm should the sea surface be and to what depth?

options.text: 5.5 C (41.9 F) to a depth of  100 meters (328 ft)
15 C (59 F) to a depth of 25 meters (82 ft)
26.5 C (79.7 F) to a depth of 50 meters (164 ft)
35.5 C (95.9 F) to a depth of  100 meters (328 ft)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 26.5 C (79.7 F) to a depth of 50 meters (164 ft)

questions.question: What scale is used only to describe hurricanes forming in the Atlantic Ocean and northern Pacific Ocean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Saffir-Simpson Hurricane Scale

questions.question: During World War I approximately how many soldiers died as a result of avalanches?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 60,000

questions.question: The Scoville scale is used to measure the hotness of what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chilli peppers

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Economics and Price
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, world, producers. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Elasticity is a term in economics which refers to the proportional change in two variables related to each other. For example, if you earn $80,000 a year and use cable TV service that costs you $100 per year, your demand for the cable service is likely to be what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Inelastic

questions.question: International trade is an important part of world economy.  Which statement about international trade is not true?

options.text: Globalization is a process closely related to international trade.
Large countries depend more on trade than smaller countries do.
Communist and socialist nations tend to aspire to complete lack of international trade (autarky).
Free trade is most strongly supported by the economically powerful nation in the world.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Large countries depend more on trade than smaller countries do.

questions.question: While the number of storms in the Atlantic has increased in past years, this does not seem to be a global trend.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: An effective minimum price imposed by the government, called price floor in economics, is usually expected to result in what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Surplus

questions.question: The phenomenon that leads individual consumers and producers to equilibrium with the market is defined by which term in economics?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The invisible hand

questions.question: Anemometers, from the Greek word anemos meaning wind, can be used to measure this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Winds Pressure and Velocity

questions.question: Having in mind the demand and supply laws, what will happen to the equilibrium of price and quantity of automobiles if wages of workers manufacturing them increase?

options.text: Price will increase; quantity will decrease.
Price will decrease; quantity will increase.
Price will increase; quantity will increase
Price will decrease; quantity will decrease

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Price will increase; quantity will decrease.

questions.question: What factor is the reason for economists to believe that countries are gradually becoming more economically interdependent?

options.text: There are many multinational corporations that design, manufacture, and sell products around the world.
Global trade is largely aided by the constant progress of technologies.
Financial markets in many countries have been opened to participants from foreign countries.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of the following statements best describes a storm surge?

options.text: Onshore rush of water associated with a low pressure weather system
Sudden and rapid increase of the intensity of a storm
Windstorm characterized by a twisting, funnel-shaped cloud

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Onshore rush of water associated with a low pressure weather system

questions.question: Which of these economic terms does not denote restriction of international trade, i.e. the free flow of goods between nations?

options.text: The General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade

questions.question: In a tropical cyclone, this area is characterized with the strongest winds, the tallest clouds, and the heaviest rain.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eyewall

questions.question: Worldwide, tropical cyclone activity peaks towards the end of which season and why?

options.text: Summer, because water temperatures are warmest
Spring, due to the rapid worming of water
Fall, as temperature rapidly falls, waters remain warm
Winter, due to the delta between air and water temperatures

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Summer, because water temperatures are warmest

questions.question: The Fujita scale rates a tornados intensity by the damage it inflicts on human-built structures, this scale classifies hurricanes by the intensity of their sustained winds.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Saffir-Simpson scale

questions.question: In economics, the Law of Supply is the direct opposite of the Law of Demand. Which of the following correlations best describes the Law of Supply?

options.text: If the price is high, demand will exceed supply.
If the price is low, supply will always be inadequate for the demand.
The higher the price, the lower the quantity supplied.
The higher the price, the larger the quantity supplied.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The higher the price, the larger the quantity supplied.

questions.question: Suppose that an increase in the price of good Y results in an increase in the demand for good X. This phenomenon is an example of which effect in economics?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The substitution effect
